DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective determine meal different fat fiber content affect postprandial plasma testosterone concentration woman polycystic ovary syndrome . Our hypothesis high-fiber meal great reduction testosterone composition compare high-fat meal .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Meal Composition Postprandial Testosterone Concentration Women With Polycystic Ovary Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: The study participant 15 woman PCOS age 19-40 . All participant must good health , non-smokers , pregnant lactating . For three day prior study visit , participant follow standard 2,000 calorie meal plan approximately 30 % fat , 55 % carbohydrate 15 % protein . On morning two study visit , participant arrive General Clinical Research Center 0700 h. A venicatheter insert antecubital vein collection blood sample catheter keep open saline . A baseline blood sample take measurement estradiol , progesterone , glucose , insulin , testosterone , sex hormone bind globulin ( SHBG ) . Participants serve test meal ask consume within 15 minute . The high-fat , low-fiber low-fat , high-fiber meal isocaloric 62 % 6 % fat , 24 % 81 % carbohydrate , 1g 26.8g fiber , respectively . After meal , blood sample take 30 minute every hour six hour measurement testosterone , SHBG , glucose insulin . During time participant remain comfortably seat recline . After last blood draw , catheter remove participant give complementary meal .
DOC.criteria: Chronic oligo/anovulation – intermenstrual period ≥ 45 day ≤ 8 menses per year . Hyperandrogenemia elevate total testosterone free androgen index ( ratio testosterone/SHBG x 100 ) . To participate study , woman must total testosterone > 50 ng/dL free androgen index > 1.5 In good general health Currently pregnant lactate Use confound medication oral contraceptive hormonal medication , lipid lower medication insulin sensitize agent metformin glitazones . Tobacco use Alcohol consumption two drink per day Unusual meal pattern ( include breakfast , breakfast 6 breakfast 10am . Untreated hyperprolactinaemia ( Prolactin > 25ng/ml ) Uncontrolled hypothyroidism History blood clot disorder Diagnosis anemia baseline visit Presence history diabetes mellitus Existence organic intra cranial lesion pituitary tumor . Presence history coronary artery disease
